articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, DAO member Naman Seth gives us an overview of Cypherock: the worlds first hardware wallet without a seedphrase backup
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Naman joined Web3 back in 2017, degened his way through the space for 4 years while being a freelance marketer. Naman is currently leading BD at Cypherock.
🚀 About Cypherock
Cypherock is a Consensys-backed startup, building the worlds first hardware wallet without a seedphrase backup.
The current issues with key management pose massive barriers to the adoption of decentralized technologies. Cypherock believes digital assets will have exponentially more value in the future and that will just not be limited to Cryptocurrency. Cypherock's mission is to empower people to be self-sovereign and to have the same peace of mind and control with their crypto and personal data that they have with their savings in the bank vaults. [Source]
Website: https://cypherock.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/CypherockWallet
GitHub: https://github.com/cypherock
Naman's NFTd: https://nf.td/nmnsth
Naman's Twitter: https://twitter.com/nmnsth
🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uq_Kx3-UTdE
articles.title: DevNTell - Cypherock

articles.author: Aayush Gupta
articles.description:
In this tutorial, we will build a custom ERC-721 NFT collection using thirdweb and Chainlink. We will use thirdweb ContractKit for the ERC-721 token standard, thirdweb deploy to deploy our smart contract to Mumbai Testnet, and Chainlink Data Feeds to fetch the realtime price of Matic to set the base price for minting NFT. We will build and deploy a smart contract that allows users to mint NFT. The user has to pay at least $1 in Matic to mint the NFT. We get the actual price conversion using Chainlink Data Feeds.
What is ERC-721?
ERC-721 is a free, open standard that describes how to build non-fungible or unique tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. While most tokens are fungible (every token is the same as every other token), ERC-721 tokens are all unique.
The ERC-721 introduces a standard fo…
articles.title: Create NFT Smart Contract with thirdweb and Chainlink

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, Developer DAO member Narb gives us an overview of his new venture called Storedat: Web3 storage made easy
🌟 Developer Spotlight
If you'd like to learn a bit about Narb you can check out the following resources:
Introductory blog post: https://narb.hashnode.dev/narb-a-web3-story
Humans of D_D Podcast:



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tm5lgiYHH2E
 
🧠 About Storedat
Storedat is a GraphQL API built on top of existing web3 storage providers like Arweave and Filecoin. We exist to accelerate the adoption of decentralized storage by providing a provider agnostic way to read and write data with those protocols all the while abstracting away web3 from the user. No dealing with wallets, signing transactions, storing private keys, paying transaction costs, and so on.
Just plug in and Storedat
Resources:
Website: https://storedat.io
Sign up for the Beta: https://auth.storedat.io
Docs: https://docs.storedat.io
API Playground: https://perma.storedat.io/api/v1/graphql
Starter template: https://github.com/Glosseta/storedat-api-starter-template
Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/storedat_io
Glosseta Foundation: https://www.glosseta.foundation
🎥 Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ULpuwe108FY
articles.title: DevNTell - Storedat.io

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
🌈 GM
In this weeks episode of DevNTell, DAO member Gery Pollak presents an overview of Blocktorch: observability for the decentralized stack
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Gery has 6 years experience working in business development at FAANG and investing in startups in central & eastern Europe as a VC. He is a self taught developer (CS50) who made his first steps in solidity development end of 2020 going through the likes of CryptoZombies, Ethernaut, DappUnivserity etc. Beginning of 2022 (at the time when he joined D_D 🙂 ) he started to work on Blocktorch together with his co-founder Amine who is a seasoned software engineer. 
🔥 About Blocktorch
Blocktorch's mission is to build an end-to-end web3 observability platform to support engineers building dApps, similar to what DataDog achieved for the cloud but with a focus on decentralized backend architecture
Website: https://www.blocktorch.xyz/


Careers: https://blocktorch.notion.site/blocktorch-careers-d9ddd67145354aa7a6c90f38aa13e08a


Docs: https://docs.blocktorch.xyz/


Twitter: https://twitter.com/blocktorch


Gery's Twitter: https://twitter.com/GeryPollak


Discord: https://discord.com/invite/5PdvH58gbj 




🎥 Presentation
articles.title: DevNTell - Blocktorch

Hedera is an open-source public distributed ledger that uses the Hashgraph as its underlying consensus algorithm. Hedera offers excellent performance, scalability, and sustainability with native token and data (consensus) services and EVM-compatible smart contracts. Further your Hedera knowledge by visiting the Hedera documentation, where you'll have the opportunity to dive deeply into core concepts about the network.

In this weeks episode of DevNTell, Developer DAO member Afoma Orji presents her project, Meta Tour
🌟 Developer Spotlight
Afoma Orji is a frontend developer and developer advocate.  She is also a contributor at 
Woman Build Web3 and a Graph Advocate at The Graph Advocate's DAO.  Afoma built Meta Tour to break free from her tutorial hell and to help people that are new to Web3 quickly navigate across the space.  
🚀About Meta Tour
Meta Tour is a simple go-to dapp that functions as a pocket map to regularly visited links by Web3 enthusiasts and users

articles.author: Osikhena Oshomah
articles.description:
This DevRel post arose from my research on Arweave for the Eden Protocol. Eden Protocol is a Developer DAO project centered on talent management. We're developing artificial intelligence to match the right people to the right opportunities at the right time. 
BluePanda, CTO of Eden, asked me to research Arweave for permanently storing endorsement data on a blockchain. This data will be generated as a person is endorsed based on their performance on a project, so long-term storage and immutability are essential. Arweave was a natural fit because it met all the requirements for implementing this feature in Eden. The astonishing thing was how simple it was to put this into action. Thanks to Arweave's clear documentation. In this post, I will share the information I gleaned from that research.…
articles.title: Getting Started With Arweave

articles.author: CryptoShuriken
articles.description:
Hey, fren! gm. 
Recently, I worked on an NFT project that required IPFS for storing the NFT images and metadata. That sparked my interest in learning more about decentralized storage, which has fascinated me for a while now.
So, today we're gonna learn about decentralized storage (let's call it DStorage for short) and some of the most popular DStorage protocols in this blog post.
Let's dive in!
What is DStorage?
As its name implies, DStorage is a storage system that does not rely on a central server or authority.
Unlike a centralized storage system managed and operated by a single centralized entity, a peer-to-peer network of user-operated nodes operates DStorage, each of which stores a copy of the data creating a resilient file storage-sharing system.
The decentralization makes it much mo…
articles.title: A Gentle Introduction to Decentralized Storage

articles.author: Deep
articles.description:
Foundry is a blazing fast, portable and modular toolkit for Ethereum application development written in Rust. It consists of three components:
Forge: Ethereum testing framework (like Truffle, Hardhat, and DappTools).
Cast: CLI for interacting with EVM smart contracts, sending transactions, and getting chain data.
Anvil: local Ethereum node, similar to Ganache or Hardhat Network.
Why Should We Use Foundry?

Its speedy; no more wasted time while running tests.
It allows you to write tests in Solidity, which minimizes context switching.
Many testing features like fuzzing, console.log, and cheat codes give you more power and flexibility.
Topics We Are Going to Cover in This Article
Project setup
How to install dependencies in Foundry (i.e., OpenZeppelin)
Integrating Foundry with VSCode
Writing…
articles.title: How to Develop and Deploy Smart Contracts with Foundry & Openzeppelin
